Author: Regnar#6164
Content: for example I think the monthly rewards requirement will actually positively help us in these rankings, without having any real material difference in the network itself. Just based on the increased tx's that are likely to be moving on KMD from people claiming rewards monthly as opposed to semi annually or annually.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: So that is a way that we can see "beating metrics". or in another case it could be how tx are counted, and whether they measure payments vs tx for different chains. again, just showing the limitations of metrics like these, but it doesn't mean we shouldn't throw it out, just think about the model as a conceptual framework, just need to understand it's limitations.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Anyway, I like the site and their measurement methods, it's a nice take on valuing networks. I am curious how a manipulative marketing value index would work. thoughts?

Author: joe2x4#5987
Content:
Hi guys,
Yesterday, I ran into a buddy that does programming in the SF bay area. As an original SN investor I gave him an over-view of the project. He mentioned that he developed some report generating backend software for a crypto tax accounting and law firm.
 
https://cryptofifo.tax

From their website when talking about their formatting..

"The format is exactly what is needed for tax return preparation, and the¬†"Assets Remaining" ledger is extremely useful for analyzing when to sell cryptocurrencies to maximize returns from a tax perspective."

So my thought process is that this type of thing could be useful for liquidity providers (maximizing returns from tax perspective). I know I and a few friends have put the breaks on Crypto trading due to uncertainty of tax obligations; was planning on becoming a liquidity provider. Combine this tax reporting software with tradebot technology and marketmaker portfolio management, could be rather useful.

Anyway, is there any use for something like this? What channel/ person would be a good contact for my developer friend.
Thanks guys

My hypothesis is most coins reduce github activity as prices decrease, and vice versa. I think it would be a good marketing point to show that Komodo doesn't decrease activity based on price, but has consistent activity.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: and having a single location for this information like CryptoMiso would make it easily replicated so other's can see the same.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
yeah we already got in contact with them - their metric is 1 repo.  that's now how we work unfortunately.  so if you really wanted to collect kmd stats across all repos, then you can get stats for other projects similarly and provide an alternative stats model to cryptomiso - unless you really wanted to do it and loved doing stats work - meh.


the current #1 for their latest 3 month ratings is this repo: https://github.com/0xProject/0x-monorepo  if you then go into the packages directory, you see they load the website into the rankings, changelog.json type of files as well.  Not to be too critical, they do a lot of commits and clearly are busy - they also merge from other repos into a central project repo which is both very organised and clap-worthy and also helpful for this type of statistic.  they may also have external repos that don't get counted like we do.

Komodo has separate repos for the wallets, the dex, notary, marketmaker, scale test, notary node operator's individual scripts etc.

And if we point out and be too critical, then our own development gets put under the microscope - why we commit changes in cpp across different servers for testing smart contracts etc.

ca has his own repos as well.  at the end of the day.  if we were to put daniel and steve's notes about blog posts, all our comments/discussions/edits/opinions in git instead of google docs, then there'd be an extra 1000 commits a month from the marketing department.

If the market prices such activity, then it's about as accurate as the mythical man month, how accurate cost estimations are in relation to LoC (lines of code) output per programmer etc.  

end rant.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Thanks for that, I was thinking of it more as in seeing if projects get ditched or back burnered if they aren't worth as much. But yea that's a quite a lot of work for potentially null value added
